Actually I bought and read through it and it is not a very good 
book. Actu=
ally let me qualify that. It is not a good book unless 
you are heavily int=
o EJB. It angles itself towards EJB using 
several different tools; however=
 in each case you just get started 
and it jumps topics. So in that sense i=
t is an intro book - just a 
bit too much intro and not enough meat (using =
the word mastering is 
just a cruel joke).

A more correct title would have=
 been "EJB using XP and Open Source 
Tools".

A very disappointing book.


=
Chip
-----

Great.  I had B&N order one last night s=
o I could look it over.  Is 
there a table of contents available for it som=
ewhere?  I checked a 
handful of sites and the description was a little vag=
ue.  Just 
wondering how in-depth it covers JUnit and if it touches on Ant,=
 
Cactus, JUnitPref, HttpUnit, etc.

Has anyone read "Java Tools for Extrem=
e Programming: Mastering Open 
Source Tools, including Ant, JUnit, and Cact=
us"?  If so, any 
opinions?  I read through it briefly and it seemed like a=
 good intro 
book.

Thanks,
Curt
